main event: On May 23, 1956, an observer reported seeing a blue light resembling a flare that appeared and disappeared behind trees.
interesting points: The object changed direction from left to right and then from right to left., The object was described as bluish-white with a star-like brilliance., The observer estimated the distance of the object to be about 5,500 feet., A witness, a clerk from Wright-Patterson AFB, indicated that a jet aircraft from WADC was likely running tests at that time., The sighting lasted for about 30 minutes.
witness description: Clerk at Wright-Patterson AFB, 29 years old, Female
